slides.title: GitHub Actions Basics
slides.content:
# GitHub Actions ğŸ™

CI/CD built into GitHub.

## Workflow Structure

```yaml
# .github/workflows/ci.yml
name: CI Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          cache: 'npm'
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      
      - name: Run tests
        run: npm test
      
      - name: Build
        run: npm run build
```

## Key Concepts

| Concept | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Workflow** | YAML file in `.github/workflows/` |
| **Event** | Trigger (push, PR, schedule) |
| **Job** | Set of steps on same runner |
| **Step** | Individual task |
| **Action** | Reusable unit (`uses:`) |

slides.title: GitLab CI/CD Basics
slides.content:
# GitLab CI/CD ğŸ¦Š

Built-in CI/CD for GitLab.

## Pipeline Configuration

```yaml
# .gitlab-ci.yml
stages:
  - build
  - test
  - deploy

variables:
  NODE_VERSION: "20"

build:
  stage: build
  image: node:${NODE_VERSION}
  script:
    - npm ci
    - npm run build
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - dist/
    expire_in: 1 hour

test:
  stage: test
  image: node:${NODE_VERSION}
  script:
    - npm ci
    - npm test
  coverage: '/Coverage: (\d+\.\d+)%/'

deploy:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./deploy.sh
  only:
    - main
  environment:
    name: production
    url: https://example.com
```

## Key Concepts

| Concept | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Stages** | Sequential phases |
| **Jobs** | Parallel within stage |
| **Artifacts** | Pass files between jobs |
| **Cache** | Speed up builds |
| **Environments** | Track deployments |

slides.title: Test Stage
slides.content:
# Test Stage ğŸ§ª

Automated quality assurance.

## Testing Pyramid

```
                 /\
                /  \  E2E Tests
               / 10 \  (Slow, few)
              /------\
             /        \  Integration
            /   20     \  Tests
           /------------\
          /              \  Unit Tests
         /      70        \  (Fast, many)
        /------------------\
```

## Test Configuration

```yaml
# GitHub Actions
test:
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Unit Tests
      run: npm run test:unit
    
    - name: Integration Tests
      run: npm run test:integration
    
    - name: E2E Tests
      run: npm run test:e2e
    
    - name: Upload Coverage
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v4
      with:
        files: ./coverage/lcov.info
```

## Test Types

| Type | Speed | Scope | When |
|------|-------|-------|------|
| **Unit** | Fast | Function | Every PR |
| **Integration** | Medium | Components | Every PR |
| **E2E** | Slow | Full app | Before deploy |
| **Smoke** | Fast | Critical paths | After deploy |

slides.title: Artifacts & Caching
slides.content:
# Artifacts & Caching ğŸ“¦

## Artifacts

Pass build outputs between jobs.

```yaml
# GitHub Actions
build:
  steps:
    - run: npm run build
    
    - name: Upload artifact
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: dist
        path: dist/
        retention-days: 5

deploy:
  needs: build
  steps:
    - name: Download artifact
      uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: dist
```

## Caching

Speed up builds by reusing dependencies.

```yaml
# GitHub Actions
- uses: actions/cache@v4
  with:
    path: |
      ~/.npm
      node_modules
    key: deps-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
    restore-keys: |
      deps-
```

## Artifacts vs Cache

| Feature | Artifacts | Cache |
|---------|-----------|-------|
| **Purpose** | Pass between jobs | Speed up builds |
| **Scope** | Same workflow run | Across runs |
| **Typical use** | Build output | Dependencies |
| **Retention** | Days | Days/weeks |

slides.title: Parallel & Matrix Builds
slides.content:
# Parallel & Matrix Builds âš¡

Run multiple configurations simultaneously.

## Matrix Strategy

```yaml
# GitHub Actions
jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest, macos-latest]
        node: [18, 20, 22]
        exclude:
          - os: windows-latest
            node: 18
    
    steps:
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node }}
      
      - run: npm test
```

## Slack Notification

```yaml
# GitHub Actions
notify:
  needs: [build, test, deploy]
  if: always()
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  steps:
    - name: Notify Slack
      uses: slackapi/slack-github-action@v1
      with:
        channel-id: 'deployments'
        payload: |
          {
            "text": "Deploy ${{ job.status }}",
            "blocks": [
              {
                "type": "section",
                "text": {
                  "type": "mrkdwn",
                  "text": "*${{ github.repository }}* deploy: ${{ job.status }}"
                }
              }
            ]
          }
      env:
        SLACK_BOT_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SLACK_TOKEN }}
```

slides.title: Best Practices
slides.content:
# CI/CD Best Practices âœ…

## Speed

- âœ… **Keep builds fast** - Target < 10 minutes
- âœ… **Cache dependencies** - Don't download every time
- âœ… **Run jobs in parallel** - Use matrix builds
- âœ… **Fail fast** - Stop early on errors

## Quality

- âœ… **Test on every PR** - No exceptions
- âœ… **Require passing checks** - Block broken merges
- âœ… **Code coverage** - Track and enforce
- âœ… **Static analysis** - Lint, security scans

## Security

- âœ… **Use secrets properly** - Never hardcode
- âœ… **Scan dependencies** - Dependabot, Snyk
- âœ… **Least privilege** - Minimal permissions
- âœ… **Audit access** - Review who can deploy

## Reliability

- âœ… **Reproducible builds** - Use lockfiles
- âœ… **Idempotent deployments** - Same input = same output
- âœ… **Rollback capability** - Know how to revert
- âœ… **Monitor deploys** - Know when things break

## Maintenance

- âœ… **Version actions** - Pin to specific versions
- âœ… **Document pipelines** - Explain complex logic
- âœ… **Review regularly** - Update and improve
